entities.description: Denotes the number of offenders in a given case.
A single instance or record within the dataset, typically representing an incident or survey response.
Specifies the type of relationship between the victim and the offender, such as spouse or common-law spouse.
Indicates cases where the number of offenders is unknown.
Specifies that the victim was the spouse or common-law spouse of the offender.
The weighted frequency of occurrences within the dataset.
The unweighted frequency of occurrences within the dataset.
Denotes cases or values that are missing from the dataset.

relationships.description: Relates a case to the number of offenders involved.
Relates a case to the type of relationship between the victim and the offenders.
Indicates that the number of offenders in a case is unknown.
Defines that the type of victim-to-offender relationship as either spouse or common-law spouse.
Relates a case to its weighted frequency in the dataset.
Relates a case to its unweighted frequency in the dataset.
Indicates that certain data points are missing for a given case.
